availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph D. Norton (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, blacksmith. )

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, blacksmith assistant and private watchman. Kentucky native. Married Margaret McDonald Norton in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, on September 21, 1862. Blacksmith assistant in Louisville in 1860. Private watchman in Jefferson County in 1865. Killed in Louisville on June 5, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 739.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482709.
"The Picnics Yesterday--Two Men Killed," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), June 6, 1865, p. 3.
"Inquest No. 354," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), June 7, 1865, p. 1.
